intro: Exacum pusillum, commonly known as the dwarf African violet, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and attractive, showy flowers. The plant typically features hairy stems and leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with five petals, and are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Exacum pusillum is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and ease of care.
